metadata.title: CVE-2022-25265 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - negligible
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel through 5.16.10, certain binary files may have theexec-all attribute if they were built in approximately 2003 (e.g., with GCC3.2.2 and Linux kernel 2.4.20). This can cause execution of bytes locatedin supposedly non-executable regions of a file.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
